subject: Negotiation
title: Gift-Giving Protocols
description: A quick, practical guide to Gift-Giving Protocols.

hook.text: A clock as a gift in China? You just wished them death. Gift-giving has invisible rules everywhere.

buildup.text: Gift-giving is essential in many cultures but the wrong gift can insult or even end a relationship.

discovery.text: In Japan, gifts are given with both hands and never opened in front of the giver. In the US, the opposite.

twist.text: Some companies ban gifts entirely â€” creating awkward moments in cultures where refusing a gift is rude.

climax.text: Research gift etiquette for every culture you negotiate with. A thoughtful gift opens doors; a careless one shuts them.

punchline.text: The best gift shows you studied their culture. The worst shows you didn't.

quiz.question: Why is gift etiquette important in international negotiations?
options: The wrong gift can insult and end a relationship
Gifts are required by international law
